page.title: 01Moorland south of Flask Inn
page.content: Predominantly high open heather moorland with a large area of conifer plantation in the south east and some woods in the north. There is some farming, mainly grazing, and mainly in the north west. There is a garage, cafe, pub, and caravan sites in the North West to serve the main A169 and the tourists. this area is quite popular with tourists because of its lack of development, impressive moorland scenery, and ease of access. Many people stop along the parking areas on the road to go walking or admire the views. The caravan sites also have easy access to the popular Robin Hoods Bay area. Residents of the block are few but are either involved in farming or the services near the road. Grouse shooting and bee-keeping may be another activity of the moors on a small scale.
